reviewText:
Early Access Review

Here is my First Play on Launch Day" video review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o35GCAPxwzA

This game has similar graphics and art to the free Steam zombie survival game called "Unturned" which has lots of rave reviews and fans

However
date: where Unturned is completely free to play
recommended: this game has a small price to play.  Is it worth it?\n\nWell
voteText: and some pretty obvious glitches are exposed in my first look gameplay video linked above.  However it seems to run and play smooth.  I haven't played nearly enough to see the depth of this game
helpfulPercent: but it looks to have a pretty deep and rewarding discovery crafting system and tons of different resources that you can collect.\n\nThe infected (zombies) are much easier to kill then they are in Unturned
votesHelpful: so this game is going to need to rely on PvP and other players to created a challenge if that's what you seek... at least at this very early point in development.  Right now
votesTotal: the balance seems to be on the "easy" side as mushrooms grow everywhere and can heal you for about 20% of your life.  The infected mobs would be lucky to get one hit on you
votesFunny: and just one of the over-abundance of red mushrooms could quickly fix that and have you running at 100% again.\n\nI will post more details about the online aspect of the game when I experience it
commentsCount: but when I played this game about an hour after it launched in early access
column16: I seemed to be the only play online playing.\n\nAs I stated at the end of my video
column17: I give the game about a 70% right now with what little i have experienced
column18: and if the online aspect turns out to be as fun and smooth as my first hour alone
column19: then that score could jump up because my "value" rating would go up for sure.\n\nDefinitely a 'two thumbs up' right now
column20: but for those looking at the price in disgust
column21: you might want to check out your free alternative here on Steam called "Unturned"\n\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

OK. Starting off must say this game needs alotta work.
That being said, I was going to give a neg review before I realized the 64bit dont run correctly.
Switched to 32bit and could finally play.
Now that I can play, I can see great potential in this game.
What sold me was after eating a can of tuna, a couple of minutes later I FARTED. Yes my character broke wind.
And it was an achievement. Clever.

Pros
1) Great graphics even on low. Awesome on high.
2) Really good lighting and shadowing. Climbimg ivy exquisite.
3) World looks clean and polished-for the most part
+ Has good texturing
4) Has a great feel to the game
5) Runs surprisingly smoothe...Did not expect that
6) Appears to have a weather biome
7) No (Sl)enderman...lol
8) Definitely does not feel like Minecrap

Cons
1) World gen needs sped up. Too slow. Buildings kinda odd shapes sometimes.
2) Sometimes spawn above all and can't move and must exit after dying
3) Better help guide (all though you will figure it out)
4) User interface could use some tweeking
5) 64bit will not run correctly. (looks worse than 32bit counterpart)
6) Starts you with weapon that has no ammo
7) Reticule goes away when using tool or weapon
8) Not enough gamers supporting Indie games

Overall
I think this is an up and coming title and more people need to geet it for support.
I will buy this for my friends to show my support.
I do believe this game can eventually go toe to toe with Minecrap

So in conclusion Dev, good job.
---LDK

PS- Would really like full controller supprt :)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is pretty neat, reminds me a lot of the F2P game Unturned but it looks much nicer. The graphics are similar in nature but much clearer and a higher resolution. As of now, there are no options (graphics, rebind controls, etc...) but I am sure that they will be implemented eventually. Buy it now if you are interested, it is on sale but it is not very playable yet and is very barebones. Give it some time and it will get better though. Also, for early access, it's pretty well optimized, runs more smoothly than any other alpha/beta I have played.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nGreat game with lots of potential. I am glad it doesn't try to immitate minecraft or unturned too much but has its own method of crafting and object/world interaction. Lots of bugs at the moment since its still in Alpha but I hope the devs will keep improving and optimising the game. The game lags a lot on my system eventhough I can easily run Crysis 3.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really like how the game looks the style is funny looking and exciting. The enemies so far are interesting.
The weapons looks great (Most of them)

Though some stuff I would like them to fix as fast as possible is:
The lighting... When the clock hits 00:00 in game it becomes black... Normally its day to night, but in this game its day to night to black.
Seriously you can't see ANYTHING. Expect the moon. The enemies are able kill you while you can't see where they are (And they keep spawning close to you)

Another thing is the crafting system might be mine that is bugged. But my recipe list don't get expended when I craft something. Also I am able to craft sticks then thats it. No matter what I do I can't craft anything else... Not even another stick.

The game has a lot of potential, but really need some updates fast.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPersonally i love this game, ive loved it since it first came out and ever since then, theres nothing wrong with it so far, theres great devs working on it well 2 ones a coder and ones an artwork designer, and for a game with this much greatness created by just two people, this game is well over achieving greatness, it also came from the steam greenlight, which makes it chosen by the players, a few bugs here and there, they are being fixed though by the lovely staff, and new content every so often, i say that this game is more than great its awesome, because in a zombie apocalypse you always have One Last Day! 10/10 I also highly recommend this game, even though its in early access its still a great game, some people would like to wait before they get a game before more content is added and thats fine but this game, this game is awesome. While its in early access its still cool.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Took me awhile to find this game, and I like it because the developer (who is very active) understands the importance of aesthetics!

For those of you who enjoy Mincraft and are looking for something *similar* (in its charm) to play on Steam, this is the game you need to support.

The most fun I ever had when playing Minecraft, was when I joined a modded server:

http://vaast.org/aftermath/

One Last Day will blow it out of the water.
